reviewText:
TL;DR: A great open world survival game with tons of stuff and zombie smashing to do with developers listening and patching accordingly. CO-OP works fine now and it's better optimized so to all the people having read the bad reviews take THIS into account. If you're into this kind of game, I highly recommend it. It's GREAT!

Now my review:

I never actually intended to buy this game, until my friends suggested it. And here I am 50 hours later I've been playing one of the few games that have hooked me in a LONG time.
It has a bit of Far Cry and Mirrors edge with a dash of Fallout in it.
The parkour and freerunning system is so smooth you never want to use roads/stairs/streets etc.
When night falls and you decide to stay outside safezones, you often find your self in FIGHT or FLIGHT situations.

Pros:

- You can bash a zombies skull in until your weapon breaks
- Great combat system with a lot of different meleeweapons (in the end game there are fewer though)
- Night time is extremely fun and exhilarating, and offers various challenges. (It has day and night cycle, which if you choose you can skip by staying in a safezone and sleep until the morning).
- Good weapon customization and crafting. You want a kitchen knife which electrifies zombies? Slap on a powercable some batteries and a conductor, tighten it with ductape and you're good to go. Real McGyver stuff right there. You want an old fashioned double-barrel shotgun to split zombies in half with? You get that too.
- A lot of sidequests, varying from interesting to down right awesome!
- Supersmooth parkour/freerunning system which makes escaping and/or exploring really fun
- At night stealth is really a good option, which makes it exciting
- You can bash a zombies skull in until your weapon breaks.
And much more!

Cons:

- Story was OK but nothing special, the ending was kind of dissapointing.
- When you're at max level you have a smaller selection of weapons which are viable.
- You can't just kill a zombie, you have to make sure it's dead by bashing it with your hammer until there's just a pulp left, or maybe that's just me.... (Not really a con, it's awesome).

I really do recommend this game, and I think you should buy it. If you like open world games with deep survival elements you will not be dissapointed. You can bash a zombies skull in until your weapon breaks. The main reason I bought the game, but hey.. I now know that it's one of the best I've played in a long time!

Thank you for reading. Good night, and GOOD LUCK!

reviewText: Dying Light is everything you liked about Dead Island, but with Mirror's Edge-style free running, and voice acting/writing that doesn't suck. The core mechanics are all incredibly solid and entertaining, complemented by skill trees that actually matter, opening up your gameplay experience as you progress through them. While the main story is pretty generic, the characters, voice acting, and motion capture make it a far more involving experience than the laughable plot and delivery of the first game's story. Surprisingly, though, the side quests are where the game really shows its character. It's not quite Dead Rising levels of bonkers, but they're quirky and interesting enough to make you want to actually do them all. On the squishy side of the banana, the game is terribly optimized, especially for any AMD components. Still, it's not bad enough to ruin what is essentially a super fun game. Pick it up on sale and blast through it - it's a hunk of zombie slaying goodness.

reviewText:
If you think this is just another zombie survival game, be ready to be surprised. The main attraction of this game is its freedom of movement. Your player character can traverse almost any path, building, walls, fences, or even poles as long as it is within reach.

The combat mechanics are intense in the beginning but slowly getting rather monotone near the end due to stronger equipment but make no mistake, it is still challenging.

Now, the night cycle. It is really an incredible idea. It intensify the survival aspect of this game and you can actually really feel the horror at the first few night cycles (or even opt to skip the night directly) but I suppose I could say that this is how Dying Light is meant to play. During Night Cycle.

Pro:
- fluid movement
- realistic cinematic story telling from the first person point of view
- intense FPS melee combat experience
- realistic application of weapon type (blunt, sharp, heavy weapon, etc)
- the sound and BGM intensify the horror which bring more fun

Con:
- despite how good the story telling is, it is actually rather short. Guess DLC will expand it somehow
- type of weapon or weapon of choice is rather limited even with the number of variation

All in all, I suggest you play it during night. Happy Zombie hunting~

This game is just fun. Plain and simple. If you have liked any zombie themed game/movie/show ever, get this game. It's the best one out there.  By day you are happily running and jumping around the city of Harran, a quarantined zone somewhere in the Middle-East. The zombies are usually easily outrun provided you are paying attention. When night falls though, the game basically turns into a survival horror.  The normal biters you fight during the day have the opportunity to turn into Virals, which are much faster, stronger and athletic.  There is no killing packs of zombies at night; you just have to run for your life...and don't look back ;)

9/10

reviewText:
It is a successor to the dead island franchise, or at least it feels like it.... if you like dead island 1 or 2, you will going to love this game, if you do not, beware.

That aside, this game is great.... it feels a jump to the moon in comparison with the dead island games.

Graphics are amazing.... you can't get more next gen than this right now.... very realistic and with amazing effects, which run just great on my laptop.... yes, laptop friendly, if you have a decent graphics card in it.

Gameplay is, like I said, very similar to dead island, scavanging for weapons, fixing them, upgrading them, leveling up and unlocking abilities, so the mechanics are basically the same, with cool weapons and abilities.

They also added pretty cool parkour moves to the game mechanics, and this makes it sooo amazing... you just can't get enough jumping and stomping zombies.

Story is a little weak, and the side missions feel like part of the story, but they distract you from advancing, to a point, that you can't tell when a story is side mission or storyline.
This is not the best zombie story out there, but it is good.

This game feel very long... I feel like I've played forever, between side missions and main story, and I'm far from halfway of the story... so it is worth the money, since you will be getting long hours, if you are completionist.

Zombies, violence, drugs and gore... if you are cool with that, I recommend it.

reviewText:
Take the best parts of Far Cry 3, Mirror's Edge, and your favorite zombie apocalypse game. Add in 4-player co-op, and invasions a la Dark Souls 2, and you've got a recipe for a great time.  I had heard about this game briefly back when it was announced and was so burned out on the zombie thing by then, I didn't think to give it a second look. When it was released, I remembered what I had heard, and after reading that it had co-op and invasions, decided I had to have it.

I jumped into the story really not having any clue what the game was about, apart from zombies, and while it's not the most exciting, original, or believable thing, it was enough to draw me into the game and get me on a path to where I cared enough about the characters I met early on to keep going. It pretty much stayed that way throughout. - nothing that I was super enthralled in, but enough to keep me going.

The big thing throughout the game is the day/night cycle and the difference between the two. After the tutorial and first major quest, you'll understand what I mean.  I don't want to ruin the fun.

The parkour-esque aspect of the game felt as good, if not better, than Mirror's Edge. Running, jumping, sliding, climbing, grappling, it's all really fluid and feels really well. Your character gets tired when it makes sense and, while there are some questionably inhuman feats, most of what you're able to do is believable apart from maybe some of the grappling stuff.

The combat feels great. Early on it can be a bit weird as you get used to the combat stamina mechanic and learn how much you can dish out before you need to take a breather, but overall it is very smooth and oddly satisfying when you bust open, chop off, or stomp on someone's/something's head.  The gunplay isn't bad either, it's about what you'd expect from something like this. There aren't but a few gun options in the game, most of which are pretty uniform throughout. If there are upgrades or options to them, I haven't found them yet.  That said, guns aren't usually the best idea anyway, as the noise can attract some pretty unfriendly folks.

The multiplayer is really satisfying. Co-op takes the singleplayer experience to a new level. It lets you drop in/out of friends games, and vice versa, and let's you help each other advance the story, create friendly competitions, or just go on zombie squashing rampages together.   If you enable Hunter Invasions, other players can invade your game as a super crazy Night Hunter" zombie and try and track down you and/or your buddies in a race to kill you before you can destroy all of its nests around town.  If you win

reviewText:
TL;DR: A great open world survival game with tons of stuff and zombie smashing to do with developers listening and patching accordingly. CO-OP works fine now and it's better optimized so to all the people having read the bad reviews take THIS into account. If you're into this kind of game, I highly recommend it. It's GREAT!

Now my review:

I never actually intended to buy this game, until my friends suggested it. And here I am 50 hours later I've been playing one of the few games that have hooked me in a LONG time.
It has a bit of Far Cry and Mirrors edge with a dash of Fallout in it.
The parkour and freerunning system is so smooth you never want to use roads/stairs/streets etc.
When night falls and you decide to stay outside safezones, you often find your self in FIGHT or FLIGHT situations.

Pros:

- You can bash a zombies skull in until your weapon breaks
- Great combat system with a lot of different meleeweapons (in the end game there are fewer though)
- Night time is extremely fun and exhilarating, and offers various challenges. (It has day and night cycle, which if you choose you can skip by staying in a safezone and sleep until the morning).
- Good weapon customization and crafting. You want a kitchen knife which electrifies zombies? Slap on a powercable some batteries and a conductor, tighten it with ductape and you're good to go. Real McGyver stuff right there. You want an old fashioned double-barrel shotgun to split zombies in half with? You get that too.
- A lot of sidequests, varying from interesting to down right awesome!
- Supersmooth parkour/freerunning system which makes escaping and/or exploring really fun
- At night stealth is really a good option, which makes it exciting
- You can bash a zombies skull in until your weapon breaks.
And much more!

Cons:

- Story was OK but nothing special, the ending was kind of dissapointing.
- When you're at max level you have a smaller selection of weapons which are viable.
- You can't just kill a zombie, you have to make sure it's dead by bashing it with your hammer until there's just a pulp left, or maybe that's just me.... (Not really a con, it's awesome).

I really do recommend this game, and I think you should buy it. If you like open world games with deep survival elements you will not be dissapointed. You can bash a zombies skull in until your weapon breaks. The main reason I bought the game, but hey.. I now know that it's one of the best I've played in a long time!

Thank you for reading. Good night, and GOOD LUCK!

reviewText: Dying Light is everything you liked about Dead Island, but with Mirror's Edge-style free running, and voice acting/writing that doesn't suck. The core mechanics are all incredibly solid and entertaining, complemented by skill trees that actually matter, opening up your gameplay experience as you progress through them. While the main story is pretty generic, the characters, voice acting, and motion capture make it a far more involving experience than the laughable plot and delivery of the first game's story. Surprisingly, though, the side quests are where the game really shows its character. It's not quite Dead Rising levels of bonkers, but they're quirky and interesting enough to make you want to actually do them all. On the squishy side of the banana, the game is terribly optimized, especially for any AMD components. Still, it's not bad enough to ruin what is essentially a super fun game. Pick it up on sale and blast through it - it's a hunk of zombie slaying goodness.

reviewText:
If you think this is just another zombie survival game, be ready to be surprised. The main attraction of this game is its freedom of movement. Your player character can traverse almost any path, building, walls, fences, or even poles as long as it is within reach.

The combat mechanics are intense in the beginning but slowly getting rather monotone near the end due to stronger equipment but make no mistake, it is still challenging.

Now, the night cycle. It is really an incredible idea. It intensify the survival aspect of this game and you can actually really feel the horror at the first few night cycles (or even opt to skip the night directly) but I suppose I could say that this is how Dying Light is meant to play. During Night Cycle.

Pro:
- fluid movement
- realistic cinematic story telling from the first person point of view
- intense FPS melee combat experience
- realistic application of weapon type (blunt, sharp, heavy weapon, etc)
- the sound and BGM intensify the horror which bring more fun

Con:
- despite how good the story telling is, it is actually rather short. Guess DLC will expand it somehow
- type of weapon or weapon of choice is rather limited even with the number of variation

All in all, I suggest you play it during night. Happy Zombie hunting~

This game is just fun. Plain and simple. If you have liked any zombie themed game/movie/show ever, get this game. It's the best one out there.  By day you are happily running and jumping around the city of Harran, a quarantined zone somewhere in the Middle-East. The zombies are usually easily outrun provided you are paying attention. When night falls though, the game basically turns into a survival horror.  The normal biters you fight during the day have the opportunity to turn into Virals, which are much faster, stronger and athletic.  There is no killing packs of zombies at night; you just have to run for your life...and don't look back ;)

9/10
